text:
The way up and the way down are one and the same.
No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.
This world, which is the same for all, no one of gods or men has made. But it always was, is, and will be: an ever-living Fire, with measures of it kindling, and measures going out.
War is the father of all and the king of all; and some he has made gods and some men, some bond and some free.
The hidden harmony is better than the obvious.
Nature loves to hide.
Eyes are more accurate witnesses than ears.
Men who love wisdom should acquaint themselves with a great many particulars.
All things are an interchange for fire, and fire for all things, just as goods for gold and gold for goods.
You cannot find the boundaries of the soul, even if you travel the whole way; so deep is its meaning.
A man's character is his fate.
Time is a game played beautifully by children.
We must not act and speak like men asleep.
Dogs bark at what they do not understand.
The awakening are shared a world, but the asleep turn aside into private worlds.
Opposition brings concord. Out of discord comes the fairest harmony.
Couples are wholes and not wholes, what agrees disagrees, the concordant is discordant. From all things one and from one all things.
It is disease that makes health pleasant; evil, good; hunger, satiety; weariness, rest.
To God all things are fair and good and right, but men hold some things wrong and some right.
The sun is new each day.
